thread.title: Bill Clinton didn't ask Donald Trump to run for president: 'I get credit for a lot I didn't do' - Showbiz
thread.title_full: Bill Clinton didn't ask Donald Trump to run for president: 'I get credit for a lot I didn't do' - Showbiz News - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Bill Clinton didn't ask Donald Trump to run for president: 'I get credit for a lot I didn't do' - Showbiz
text: Former US president Bill Clinton promises that he did NOT convince Donald Trump to run for president.A popular conspiracy theory has gathered steam online, around the Clintons purportedly urging Trump to run for the Republican nomination in order to secure an easier path to the White House in 2016.Asked to set the record straight by Stephen Colbert on The Late Show on Tuesday (October 7), Clinton chuckled at the notion of being such a ruthless political power-broker."I get credit for doing a lot of things I didn't do," he joked.The former US leader also offered his expertise on why Trump has had such a strong appeal for Republican voters. "He's a master brander, and he's the most interesting character out there," Clinton explained. "He says something that overrides the ideological differences. At the first debate, a lot of those guys were competing for who could be the most politically correct. "Trump says, 'Okay, I've supported Democrats, I've supported Republicans. Yeah, I used to be friends with Bill Clinton. Who cares? I run things and I've built things. You need somebody who can go in there and fix it. If they don't let me fix it, I'll just get them out of the way'. It may have a short [shelf]-life for his campaign, I can't tell yet. Â© Bank via Getty Images "He's a master brander, and there's a macho appeal to saying, 'I'm just sick of nothing happening. I make things happen. Vote for me'."Earlier this week, Trump insisted that he has no plans to exit the presidential race in spite of dipping poll numbers in recent weeks.The Late Show with Stephen Colbert airs weeknights on CBS.
